Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given a list of activities in a global supply chain process. The activities are: SS: Supplier Selection OP: Order Placement RC: Receive Components QI: Quality Inspection CA: Component Assembly PT: Product Testing PK: Packaging WS: Warehouse Storage DT: Distribution AS: After-Sales Support Given the activities, we can assume a typical linear order: SS -> OP -> RC -> QI -> CA -> PT -> PK -> WS -> DT -> AS

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: How to estimate the average and standard deviation? We have to assign for each pair (A, B) an average time and std based on the typical time it takes from the end of A to the end of B. Well assign: Adjacent pairs: (SS, OP): average time = 3600 seconds (1 hour), std = 1800 seconds (30 minutes) (OP, RC): Average: 30 days = 30*24*3600 = 2592000 seconds, std: 5 days = 432000 seconds. (RC, QI): Average: 2 hours = 7200 seconds, std: 1 hour = 3600 seconds. (QI, CA): Average: 1 hour = 3600 seconds, std: 0.5 hour = 1800 seconds. (CA, PT): Average: 30 minutes = 1800 seconds, std: 10 minutes = 600 seconds. (PT, PK): Average: 1 hour = 3600 seconds, std: 0.5 hour = 1800 seconds. (PK, WS): Average: 0.5 hour = 1800 seconds, std: 0.2 hour = 720 seconds. (WS, DT): Average: 7 days = 604800 seconds, std: 2 days = 172800 seconds. (DT, AS): average = 3600 seconds (1 hour), std = 1800 seconds (30 minutes)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: for non-adjacent, we have to add the waiting times and durations of all intermediate activities. the time between two non-adjacent activities is the sum of the times of the adjacent pairs in between. And if we assume independence, then the variance is the sum of the variances. Therefore, for any pair (A_i, A_j) with i < j, average_time = sum_{k=i}^{j-1} average_time(A_k, A_{k+1}) std = sqrt( sum_{k=i}^{j-1} (std(A_k, A_{k+1})^2 ) )

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: the problem says a representative subset, so we dont have to include all 45? But the problem also says ensuring complexity by considering pairs of activities that may be separated by multiple steps. So we should include pairs that are not adjacent. Well include: All adjacent pairs (9 pairs) Non-adjacent: (SS,RC), (SS,CA), (SS,DT), (OP,AS), (CA,AS)

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: since 432000 is much larger than 1800, we can approximate std 432000. But the problem requires a standard deviation. Well use the exact. Well round to the nearest integer.
